knimeNode.name: PNN Learner
knimeNode.shortDescription: Trains a Probabilistic Neural Network (PNN) on labeled data.

fullDescription.intro:
Generates a Probabilistic Neural Network (PNN) on labeled data using
Constructive Training of Probabilistic Neural Networks as underlying algorithm.
All numeric columns are used as input columns for training. One additional column is used as a classification target. The input port contains the training data, the data output port contains the center vectors of the PNN rules. The algorithm uses high-dimensional Gaussian functions to cover instances that are adjusted by two thresholds, theta minus and plus, during the learning process. New prototypes are commited until all examples have been correctly covered.
fullDescription.option: Select column to be used as classification attribute.
Select method to handle missing values.
Check, if a shrink should be performed immediately after a new rule has been introduced. Shrink means the new rule is reduced so that a conflict with all other rules is avoided.
Default theta minus value is 0.2. This is the upper bound of activation for conflicting rules.
Default theta plus value is 0.4. This is the lower bound of activation for non-conflicting rules.

ports.dataIn: Data used for training. Should contain numeric data, as well as one target attribute for classification.
ports.dataOut: Table with generated center vectors and a classification attribute.
ports.modelOut: Generated PNN model can be used for prediction.

views.view: Shows a summary of the generated PNN rule model.
